alert.note: Alert for Bucks; Montgomery; Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 27 at 8:00PM EDT until June 27 at 9:45PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTH CENTRAL BUCKS, EAST CENTRAL MONTGOMERY, AND NORTHEASTERN PHILADELPHIA COUNTIES... At 800 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated the heavy was coming to an end. But flooding still persisted. Flash flooding was reported in Bensalem and Abington. The Pennypack Creek and Poqueesing Creeks were both out of their banks. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Philadelphia, Bensalem, Abington, Bryn Athyn, Northeast Philadelphia, Feasterville-Trevose, Feasterville, Willow Grove, Churchville, and Cornwells Heights-Eddington. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 345 and 353. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
